intro: Lavoisiera scabrella, commonly known as the rough lavoisiera, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
